titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Howard Cann Collection MC.127
titlestmt.author: Jennifer E. Neal

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:42:27 -0400.

change.item: Updated by Jennifer E. Neal to incorporate materials being sent offsite in 2019

did.abstract: Howard Cann coached basketball for thirty-five years at New York University, from 1923-1958.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the Howard Cann Collection is restricted until materials are arranged and described by an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Howard Goodsell Cann was a college basketball and football player, and an Olympic shot putter. He coached basketball for thirty-five years at New York University, from 1923-1958. Materials in this collection include certificates, awards, and diplomas from various athletic associations honoring Cann's career as an athlete and coach. There are also certificates of honor from Cann's naval service and an American flag.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Howard Cann Collection; MC 127; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These materials contain mainly certificates, awards and diplomas from various athletic associations honoring Howard Cann's career as an athlete and coach. Included as well are certificates of honor from Cann's naval service and an American flag.

did.unittitle: Framed Photo of Julius Silver Institute of Bio-Medical Engineering Sciences, Technio City, Haifa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ID Number: 456. Description: Color portrait of the Silver building, matted with silver frame. Creator/Donor/Subject: Julius Silver.
